TopicTitle: VS2015 Wants KSPUtil v0.0.0.0 while I am modding for the 1.2.2 and have Assembly-CSharp

Articles.Content:
So I have a mod, and it's in VS2015. Also it uses the Vwctor3d class Vessel.obt_velocity. Now VS says I need KSPUtil for that class. What do?

http://imgur.com/a/GJlMq

Edited January 13, 2017 by JuhaJGamer
Pic
It shouldn't be showing that. Vector3D is in Assembly-CSharp in the current KSP version. Make sure you're reference to Assembly-CSharp is pointing to the correct DLL.

9 hours ago, Aelfhe1m said:

It shouldn't be showing that. Vector3D is in Assembly-CSharp in the current KSP version. Make sure you're reference to Assembly-CSharp is pointing to the correct DLL.

It is
I'm clearly not a C# guru, and dunno if it can be related to your problem, but, do you use the right version of .NET ? You need the 3.5 version for KSP.

You have to reference the file in "\KSP_x64_Data\Managed\Assembly-CSharp.dll".

It should have a change date of 7th of december.

Assembly-CSharp does hold the Vector3d in KSP 1.2.2.

In the previous version, i.e. 1.1.x, there was indeed a KSPUtil.dll and it has been merged into the "Assembly-CSharp" now. If it asks for KSPUtil, you are most likely having some outdated reference. So I agree with Aelfhe1m, you need to double check your references.

Edited January 16, 2017 by Warezcrawler
